flow.descriptionCdata:
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.0eca3692-8d09-4222-8eec-1f259a5c5c91.prompt=Enter a value for targetHost 83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.2d795b0d-b083-463c-9054-6346fafc8fd6.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.2f96013c-009c-47ac-98e2-913feee96622.description=
Generates an href HTML link that contains a URL to the run history report for the current run.

Inputs\:
    variablename  - The name of the flow variable where the result should be stored (default\: IC_ReportURL)
    displaytext - The text to display for the href link (default\: "Run History Report Available Here")

Results\:
Result - The untagged URL to the run report for the current run.

Responses\:
    success - The flow completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The flow completed unsuccessfully.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.3e128bb2-fa2a-4d07-8e88-6bdab92b3452.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.3e969a5f-f6ad-465c-b2f4-ca97f131c232.description=Creating health report. 83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.4581d78c-d345-468f-80d5-eae650a9092f.prompt=Please enter a user name\: 83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.483f02b2-91ca-4a77-bfa2-82b6dc991fd9.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.577cc7ac-a724-4c09-921f-d792064866c6.description=
Queries how long it has been since the target computer was rebooted.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.6af06228-a216-4a42-b88c-63ebec0ee0fe.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.762f3988-0d17-44b2-b9f3-7d23542b729a.description=
Runs the Ping command locally. 

Input Parameters\:
targetHost - target host to ping
packetSize - size of the ping packet
packetCount - number of packets to send

Responses\:
success - the command was executed successfully
failure - the command could not be executed

Returns\:
packetsSent - the number of packets sent
packetsReceived - the number of packets received
percentagePacketsLost - the percentage of packets lost
transmissionTimeMin - minimum time taken for transmitting the packet
transmissionTimeMax - maximum time taken for transmitting the packet
transmissionTimeAvg - average time taken for transmitting the packet
returnResult - the raw output of the command
returnCode - return code from the executed command
error - the STDERR of the command
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.8bb8a309-4356-41f5-9699-08c9a09794f8.prompt=enter host 83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.9ae7e8a4-5c6f-4647-9644-80d03ba57128.description=
Sends an smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
    readReceipt - Default is false. The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false.
    attachments - A deliimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - The password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments. This input defaults to ',' if left empty.
 
Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.aee59464-9ba4-4d0b-97e3-2061452d4d18.prompt=Please enter a password\: 83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.d80c0809-1500-470f-aca0-23a4421c277e.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.description=
This flow checks the overall health of a Windows server. It checks for many common problems, such as testing if the server is running, how much free memory the server has, and what percentage of its CPU is currently being utilized. A summary of the server's health is then either sent as email, displayed on the screen, written to a file or ignored.

NOTE\:
Only Windows XP, Windows 2003 and later versions track system uptime. Previous systems will always fail to obtain system uptime.

Inputs\:
host - The server to check the health of.
user - The username to use when authenticating with the host. Not required for localhost.
password - The password to use when authenticating with the host. Not required for localhost.
notifyMethod - How to notify the user the out come of the health check.
vitalProcesses - A list of comma separated values giving the name of the processes that are vital for Windows and should be running. Currently, this value is set to\: 				                      svchost.exe,lsass.exe,smss.exe,System,explorer.exe,services.exe,winlogon.exe
	     New processes can be added or existing ones can be removed from the list.	
packetCount - The number of ping packets to send.
packetSize - The size of the ping packet.

Responses\:
success - Health check prepared.
failure - Something went wrong.
83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.ede1886c-588d-4d67-91e8-5d3f437150af.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:

83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.f66b4341-1349-4764-b4fe-cbf220b61f15.description=Checking number of processes, threads, and their statuses. 83744436-71ba-42f3-a1d2-224f4678dad8.fc548a97-0e6a-46cc-a23e-a3135c384b60.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wql query - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
flow.name: E3 Windows Health Check

scriptlet.name: Step Get Host Name in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (d80c0809-1500-470f-aca0-23a4421c277e)
Step Resolved : success in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (6d953daf-9022-45bc-9d1d-7ba15aca5e93)
Step Check for Malfunctioning Devices in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (ede1886c-588d-4d67-91e8-5d3f437150af)

staticBinding.value: Select * from Win32_PnPEntity where Status = 'Error' OR Status = 'Pred Fail' OR Status = 'Stressed ' OR Status = 'NonRecover'

scriptlet.name: Step Ping Target System in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (762f3988-0d17-44b2-b9f3-7d23542b729a)
Step Get Processor Count/Status in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (f66b4341-1349-4764-b4fe-cbf220b61f15)
Step Get System Uptime in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (577cc7ac-a724-4c09-921f-d792064866c6)
Step Get Network Interface Errors in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (fc548a97-0e6a-46cc-a23e-a3135c384b60)

staticBinding.value: Select Name, ConfigManagerErrorCode from Win32_NetworkAdapter where ConfigManagerErrorCode > 0

scriptlet.name: Step Free Physical Memory in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (483f02b2-91ca-4a77-bfa2-82b6dc991fd9)
Step Get FileSystem Information in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (2d795b0d-b083-463c-9054-6346fafc8fd6)

staticBinding.value: Select Name, FreeSpace, Size from Win32_LogicalDisk

scriptlet.name: Step Get Running Process List in Flow E3 Windows Health Check (6af06228-a216-4a42-b88c-63ebec0ee0fe)
